results.title: Big hearted kid
results.brief_description:
Cameron through the use of his “talker” tells of his background, his intense shyness as a child and lack of confidence until the age of 23 when Karen, Rhonda and Mel came into his life. He has become a role model for kids aged 6 to 14 who use talkers and an inspiration to all those who work with him in the disability area.
This project was funded by the Department of Human Services, (Eastern Metropolitan Region), developed and executed in partnership with MetroAccess at the City of Monash and City of Whitehorse, and Scope.

results.title: Big H
results.creator_credit: David Perry, Australia Council and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: An example to educators of what can be done to arouse and maintain children’s interest in the arts. Howard Spicer is known to thousands of school children all over Australia as “Big H” - the Operatic Bikie. Dressed in leather, he rides his motorbike into classrooms and introduces young people to opera. Using Spicer’s work as an example the film illustrates the concept of innovative arts. Suitable for secondary years 7-12, teachers and tertiary level.

results.title: Big Gig
results.brief_description: A humorous driver training video which is directed at young drivers in need of more driving experience. The video, through the use of humour, science fiction and rock music, positively reinforces correct approaches to drinking. It covers issues such as the difficulties of night driving, the problems of peer group pressure and the effects of alcohol on driving.

results.title: Big game fishing in Australia
results.creator_credit: Dennis Hill Productions, Joe Scully and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Australian waters are an exciting setting for big game fishing. Not only are the fish big and full of fight, but the Great Barrier Reef provides a setting of unequalled beauty. This film captures the excitement of a world record marlin catch by New Zealander Sir William Stevenson in the waters off Cairns, in Northeast Australia. It weighed 1231 lbs.

results.title: Big Game
results.creator_credit: Jarrod Hasenjager and The Animation School (Cape Town)
results.brief_description:
Bobo, a lonely monster, is set to spend another birthday alone, until a cunning monster hunter throws him a killer surprise party!
Animators: Sarah Scrimgeour, Aarin Lehmkuhl, Romy Latter, Miro Kolenic, Jarrod Hasenjager, Matthew Furnell.
Animation: Aarin Lehmkuhl, Matthew Furnell
Production Designers: Jarrod Hasenjager, Sarah Scrimgeour, Romy Latter
Sound: Andrew Schar, Kamil Govender

group_works.title: Beyond the edge: professionals at play

results.title: Big fish
results.creator_credit: Tim Burton, Dan Jinks, Bruce Cohen, Richard Zanuck, Zanuck Company, Cohen Company, Jinks and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Adapted from Daniel Wallace’s novel “Big Fish: A Novel of Mythic Proportions” comes Tim Burton’s twentieth feature film since his directorial debut in 1971. “Big Fish” is a sentimental exploration of the ambiguous line between fact and fiction, as a man (Billy Crudup) makes a final attempt at getting to know his dying father (Albert Finney). Mythical tall tales told to the man repeatedly throughout his life by his father are revealed to the viewer with Ewan McGregor playing the father as a young man. A departure from Burton’s traditionally darker oeuvre “Big Fish” challenges notions that truth should be pursued before an embellished reality. Cast includes Jessica Lange and Helena Bonham Carter. Nominated for four Golden Globe Awards.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tim Burton, Dan Jinks, Bruce Cohen, Richard Zanuck, Zanuck Company, Cohen Company, Jinks and Columbia Pictures
